title: Transformations of Functions: Part B
body:
These problems are generally harder, often highlighting an important subtlety. Use the "safe order of transformations" for transforming $$y=f(x)$$ $$ightsquigarrow$$ $$y=A+B f{\left(C x+Dight)}$$ to give a sequence of five elementary transformations whose composition transforms $$y=f(x)$$ into $$y=-8+ rac{1}{4} f{\left(\left(- rac{1}{2}ight) x-3ight)}$$. The first step is completed for you.

Start with the original: $$y=f(x)$$

First translate right $$3$$ units, $$y=f(x-3)$$
